interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This change involves the addition of multiple words ("قال", "الرب", "للذين", "اتوا", "اليه", "من", "اليهود"), which clearly fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word, regardless of whether the words are major or minor.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This change involves the addition of multiple words ("قال", "الرب", "للذين", "اتو", "اليه", "من", "اليهود"), which clearly fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word, regardless of whether the words are major or minor.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change from اتوا to اتو is an alteration to the spelling of the word without affecting its meaning, specifically the omission of the final alif in اتوا, which is a characteristic of orthographic changes, similar to the example where قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود, and also similar to the example where تكونوا احرار → تكونو احرار, where the alif for the plural verb is omitted.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

This change is categorized as a Single_Major_Word_Change because the entire word or phrase "فكلمهم ايضا يسوع" is being omitted, which is a major word change since it involves the removal of a significant portion of the text, similar to the example where "كثير" is omitted, which is classified as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

This change involves the addition of two words: the major word "صوته" and the conjunction "و", which affects the overall structure of the sentence, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to examples like "اجاب يسوع فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" where two changes occur.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change from ⸂يمشي في الظلمه الي⸃ to ⸂يمشي فى الظلمه⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word "في" to "فى", which is a change in orthography, similar to examples where the spelling of words is standardized or corrected without affecting their meaning, such as the example "اللاه → الااله" or "اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم".
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

This change is best categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a single minor word, specifically the preposition "مع" being changed to "ل", which is similar to the example given where "الدهر بل تكون له" is changed to "الدهر بل تكون معه" - both involve a change to a preposition with a pronominal suffix, indicating a minor word change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

This change involves altering two major words ("الابد" to "الدهر" and "مع" to "له") which fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, however since "بل تكون" is also changed to "بل يكون", this confirms it's indeed Multiple_Word_Changes, I apologize, my mistake, it should be Multiple_Word_Changes because more than one word is changed.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from الابد to الدهر involves changing the root of the word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like كثير → OMIT or يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the word is changed, and the rest of the sentence remains the same.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This change is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a single minor word, namely the preposition "مع" being changed to "له", which is similar to the example given where "الدهر بل تكون له" is changed to "الدهر بل تكون معه" and both are categorized as Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل تكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ involves modifying the verb form "تكون" to "يكون", which affects the person or number of the verb, making it a change to a minor word, specifically a modification in verb form, which fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ involves modifying the preposition "له" to "معها" which is not a change in the root word itself but rather a modification to a preposition with a pronominal suffix, fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as seen in the example: الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves the addition of the definite article 'ل' which is considered a minor word, and the change in the verb form from 'يكون' to 'تكون' which also affects a minor word, specifically the verb conjugation, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves the addition of a definite article 'ال' before 'الدهر', which is considered a minor word change according to the given definitions, similar to the example where 'الدهر بل تكون له' is changed to 'الدهر بل تكون معه' which also involves a change to a preposition with a pronominal suffix.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The justification for this decision is that the change involves adding a new major word 'نور' which has a different root, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to examples like 'كثير → OMIT' where a major word is either added or omitted.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

This change involves adding a new major word "الي" which has a different root, making it a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definition provided, similar to the example where "كثير" is omitted or "شيطان" is added.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This change involves more than one word: the word 'اجاب' is omitted and the word 'فقال' is moved before 'لهم', and 'يسوع' is moved after 'فقال لهم', thus it affects the order and presence of multiple words, which aligns with the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

This change is categorized as Orthography because it involves a change in the spelling of the word "ايسوع" to "يسوع", which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to the example where "ajsab aysuʿ" is changed to "ajsab ysūʿ".
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

This change involves substituting the conjunction و with the conjunction ف, which is a minor word change as per the definition, similar to the example where فقالوا is changed to وقالوا, and the change from فقال to فقال لهم, both of which are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This change involves the addition of the minor word اجاب before the verb فقال, which is similar to the example where وان is changed to ان, or where اجاب يسوع فقال is changed to اجاب يسوع فقال لهم, both of which are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This change is categorized as Orthography because the alteration is in the spelling of the word "يسوع" which is changed to "ايسوع", and the conjunction "و" is changed to "ف", however the latter change is minor and does not affect the root of the word, thus the overall change is still within the realm of orthography, similar to the example where "ajsab yaswaʿ" is changed to "ajsab ayaswaʿ".
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change from ⸂وانتم انما⸃ to ⸂انتم⸃ involves the omission of the conjunction و and the word انما, however since انما is a minor word being a combination of a negation and a pronoun, but the main issue here is that more than one word is affected which suggests Multiple_Word_Changes, nonetheless given the definition allows for changes to parts of speech like conjunctions and pronouns even when they affect the meaning, yet the fact that two elements are changed puts this outside the scope of Single_Minor_Word_Change, hence making it fit better with Multiple_Word_Changes due to the involvement of more than one word.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

This change involves omitting the entire phrase "ايما تقضون" which is a major word change since it's not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or preposition, and thus fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

This change is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a single minor word, in this case, the verb form "تقضون" is changed to "تقضوا", which affects the person or number of the verb, and this type of modification is characteristic of changes to minor words as defined in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

This change involves substituting the conjunction ام (ama) with و (wa), which is a minor word change as per the definition, similar to examples like وان → ان where the conjunction و is added, or اما الابن → واما الابن where the conjunction و is added.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change from واما to وان involves the substitution of a minor word (the conjunction/particle), which aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like وان → ان where a conjunction is added or removed.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

This change is categorized as Orthography because the alteration involves adding an alif of nasb to احد and also adding a conjunction ف at the start, however since the latter is a minor word change and the former is an orthographic change, the overall change is still considered minor and thus best fits the definition of Orthography due to the nature of the changes, especially considering the addition of the alif which is explicitly mentioned in the definition of Orthography.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves the addition of a minor word, specifically the conjunction "ف" at the beginning of the phrase, which is similar to examples like "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" or "فقالوا → وقالوا" where a minor word is added or changed, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves the addition of a conjunction, specifically the prefix "ف" to the beginning of the phrase, which is a minor word change according to the given definitions, similar to the example where "ليست واحدى" changes to "فليس ادين احدًا" with the conjunction "ف" being added at the start.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves the addition of a minor word, specifically the conjunction "ف" at the beginning, which does not affect the root or the major elements of the sentence, similar to examples like "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" where a minor adjustment is made without altering the fundamental meaning or structure of the phrase.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂فليس ادين احدا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves the removal of an alif of nasb, which is a change in orthography that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to examples like "تكونوا احرار → تكونوا احرارا" or "احد → احدا".
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This change is categorized as Orthography because the only difference between the two readings is the presence or absence of an alif of nasb, which is a change in orthography that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to the example where 'احد' is changed to 'احدا'.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This change involves the substitution of multiple words: "لاني" is replaced by "هو لان", which involves changing more than one word, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to examples like "انا اياه → فهو" where two words are changed.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change from ليست to ليس is a modification in verb form which affects the meaning substantially but only involves a change to a minor word, specifically a verb, and does not alter the root of the word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change from ليست to ليس is a modification in verb form, which is considered a minor word change according to the definition, since it doesn't change the root of the word and affects the meaning substantially but is limited to a change in verb form, thus fitting the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change from ⸂ولكني⸃ to ⸂لكنى⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word, specifically changing the position of the letters, which is an example of an orthographic change, similar to the example of ابرهيم → ابراهيم where an alif is added to the spelling of ابرهيم.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.
The change from ⸂حق⸃ to ⸂OMIT⸃ involves omitting a major word, which aligns with the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like كثير → OMIT, where a major word is omitted.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The change from ⸂حق⸃ to ⸂حق هي⸃ involves adding a minor word, which is the pronoun "هي". This fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves the addition of a minor word, specifically a pronoun, without altering the root of any major word.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change from ⸂انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves the addition of a conjunction و, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like وان → ان where the conjunction و is added.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

This change involves omitting the major word نفسى, which has a different root and is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change from على to لي involves a modification of a preposition, which is considered a minor word, and thus fits within the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه, where the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

This change involves replacing one word ("على") with another word ("لي"), and also adding a new word ("وهو"), which fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو
The change from ذلك to وهو involves adding a new word وهو which is a major word, as it has a different root compared to ذلك, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂يسوع⸃ to ⸂ايسوع⸃ is an example of an orthographic change because the alteration is merely an addition of an 'أ' (alif) at the beginning of the word, which does not affect its meaning or grammatical function, similar to the example where the spelling of 'يسوع' is changed to 'ايسوع'.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a single minor word, specifically the conjunction "ف" being replaced by the conjunction "و", which is similar to examples like "اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" where the conjunction "ف" is changed to "و" and the preposition "(with suffix) لهم" is added, however in our case only one minor word is changed.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change from ⸂كان يكلمهم⸃ to ⸂كلمهم⸃ involves the omission of the minor word "كان" which is a verb form indicating past tense, thus it falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it modifies the verb form without changing the root word.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change from ساعته to ساعه is an alteration in the spelling of the word without affecting its meaning, which fits the definition of Orthography, similar to the example where اللاه is changed to الااله, both being variant spellings for 'the God', and the example where اجاب يسوع فقال لهم is changed to اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم, where the spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change from ساعته to الساعه is an alteration in spelling or orthography, where the addition of the definite article 'ال' does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word 'ساعه', thus fitting the definition of an orthographic change.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

The change from لان to اذ and from ساعه to كانت involves changes to more than one word, which matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "لان ساعته لم" is changed to "اذ كانت لم".
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The reason for choosing Single_Major_Word_Change is that the root of the word تكن is changed to a completely different root اقتربت, which signifies a change in the major word, and this is the only change between the two readings.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change from ⸂تكون اتت⸃ to ⸂تكن اتت⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word "تكون" to "تكن", which is a change in orthography as it does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to examples like اللاه → الااله or ابرهيم → ابراهيم.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The change from ⸂تكون اقتربت⸃ to ⸂تكن اتت⸃ involves changing the root of the word, which aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like "تكون اتت → تكون اقتربت" where the verb اتت is changed to اقتربت, indicating a change in the root of the word.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is changed to "انطلق", "طلبوني" is changed to "طلبونى", "في" is changed to "ولا". Since more than one word is changed, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب" is changed to "اين جيت ولا اين انطلق".
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا
The change from و to OMIT (absence of text) affects a single minor word which is a conjunction, thus fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

The change involves multiple words: "خطاياكم" is replaced by two words "تجدونى" and "وباثمكم", which fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as changes across more than one word, even if the changes are minor.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change from تموتون to تموتوا is a modification in verb form, specifically a change in person or number, which falls under the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where تكونوا is changed to تكونون.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The change from انطلق to اذهب involves changing the root of the word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the verb is changed, or aktif → shitan where the major word aktif is changed to the major word shitan.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is changed to "انطلق", and "انا" remains the same but "فانتم" is added, which affects more than one word, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

The change from ليس to لا involves changing the root of the word, which makes it a major word change, and since only one major word is changed, it fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where OMIT → شيطان, a new major word شيطان is added.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

However, since there are two changes, one might initially think it should be categorized as 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. But given that one of the changes is orthographic and not affecting the meaning, we focus on the other change which is indeed minor. Yet, considering the definition strictly, when there are changes to multiple words, even if they are minor, it should be categorized under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. Thus, upon reevaluation, the correct categorization should reflect the fact that two elements are altered, hence it fits better with 'Multiple_Word_Changes' due to the presence of multiple changes, despite one being orthographic in nature.

The change from ⸂شيطان⸃ to ⸂الشيطان⸃ involves adding the definite article ال to the major word شيطان, however since the change affects a minor word, which is the definite article, this change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where اللاه is changed to الله, which also involves the removal of the definite article.
c.f. شيطان ➞ الشيطان

The change from ف to و is a change to a minor word, specifically a conjunction, which fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where وان is changed to ان, or where فقالوا is changed to وقالوا.
c.f. فانت سامري ➞ وانت سامري
Multiple words are added.

This change involves the addition of two words "اجاب ايسوع", which affects more than one word, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "فقال لهم" is changed to "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود" with multiple words added.
c.f. فقال ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال
The preposition (with suffix) لهم is added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start and the major word شيطان is omitted.

This change involves altering the conjunction "اما" to "ان", which is a change to a minor word, and also changing "فليس" to "ليس" which is a change to a minor word, and changing "في" to "فى" which is an orthographic change that can be ignored according to the problem description, thus the overall change is a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ ان شيطان ليس فى

The change from شيطان to الشيطان is an alteration in orthography, specifically the addition of the definite article ال which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, thus fitting the definition of an orthographic change.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

The change from ⸂اما شيطان فليس في⸃ to ⸂اما شيطان فليس⸃ involves the omission of the word "في", which is a minor word (preposition), however since the change affects only this minor word, it could fit the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, but given that the word "في" has a grammatical function and its removal doesn't affect the root or the meaning of other words, and considering the examples provided where the addition or removal of minor words like prepositions were classified under Single_Minor_Word_Change, this specific case seems to align more closely with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change. However, upon closer inspection, we see the word "في" is indeed a minor word and its removal does not alter the root of any word, thus it fits better within the Single_Minor_Word_Change category due to the nature of the word being a preposition which was added/omitted.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما شيطان فليس

The change from ان to اما is a change to a minor word (a conjunction), and the change from ليس to فليس is also a change to a minor word (the conjunction ف is added and the form of ليس is changed). Since both changes affect different words, even though each change individually would fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change, together they constitute a change across more than one word, which puts this variant in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. ان شيطان ليس فى ➞ اما شيطان فليس

This change is categorized as a Single_Major_Word_Change because the root of the word "انا" is different from the root of the word "الشيطان", which makes it a change to a single major word, even though "فама" was changed to "اما", the latter is a minor word change, however since there are two changes, one being a major word change and the other a minor word change, the overall categorization is Multiple_Word_Changes is not accurate since only one major word change occurred and the rest are minor, hence it fits better in Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where "كثير" is omitted, or where "يعتقكم" is changed to "ايعرفكم".
c.f. فاما انا فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

The change from الشيطان to شيطان is an alteration in spelling or orthography, specifically the removal of an alif, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, fitting the definition of Orthography.
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

The change from ⸂التمس⸃ to ⸂اطلب⸃ involves changing the root of the word, which is a characteristic of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to examples like يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the verb is changed, or بيت الكنز → بيت القربان where the noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب

This change involves omitting the major word اطلب, which has a different root and is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

The change from هو to الذى involves changing the root of the word, which is a characteristic of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where يعتقكم is changed to ايعرفكم, where the root of the verb is changed, or where كثير is omitted, which also changes a major word.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

This change involves more than one word: both "هو" and "الذي" are swapped, thus it cannot be classified under Single_Minor_Word_Change or Single_Major_Word_Change, and it's not merely an orthographic change, hence it fits best with Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو
This change involves omitting the major word "ان", which is a significant alteration to the text, fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change as it involves the omission of a major word.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

The change from الابد to الدهر involves changing the root of the word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like كثير → OMIT or يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the word is changed, and the rest of the sentence remains the same.
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
